user_error_text: Input device not detected appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Input device not detected. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Input device not detected - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Black screen after GPU update — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after GPU update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Black screen after GPU update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Blue screen after driver update' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen after driver update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Driver_IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver_IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Driver_IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Display driver stopped responding' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display driver stopped responding. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Display driver stopped responding - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Unsigned driver blocked — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Unsigned driver blocked. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Unsigned driver blocked - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Mouse lag due to driver. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Mouse lag due to driver. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Mouse lag due to driver - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: No output device found appears and the device is unavailable.

cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.

user_error_text: Error: Ethernet driver not installed — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ethernet driver not installed. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Ethernet driver not installed - Driver event logged in system.

cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.

user_error_text: Windows Update driver failure appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update driver failure. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Windows Update driver failure - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Blue screen after driver update. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen after driver update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: UEFI driver mismatch appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: UEFI driver mismatch. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Firmware / BIOS-Dependent Driver Errors.
cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.
step_5: If unsure, contact vendor support for guided firmware/driver updates.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: UEFI driver mismatch - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Audio device not detected appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio device not detected. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: Driver timeout during gaming appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver timeout during gaming. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Driver timeout during gaming - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Realtek driver failure - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Ethernet driver not installed appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ethernet driver not installed. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Ethernet driver not installed - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Audio service not responding — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: BIOS update required for device. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: BIOS update required for device. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Firmware / BIOS-Dependent Driver Errors.
cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.
step_5: If unsure, contact vendor support for guided firmware/driver updates.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: BIOS update required for device - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: USB device malfunctioned. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: USB device malfunctioned. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: USB device malfunctioned - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Network adapter missing. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Network adapter missing. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Network adapter missing - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Mouse lag due to driver' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Mouse lag due to driver. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Mouse lag due to driver - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: USB driver not recognized appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB driver not recognized. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Black screen after GPU update. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after GPU update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Black screen after GPU update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Device not initialized' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device not initialized. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Device not initialized - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Driver installer error' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver installer error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Driver installer error - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Driver installer error appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver installer error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Driver installer error - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: CM_PROB_FAILED_START — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: CM_PROB_FAILED_START. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: CM_PROB_FAILED_START - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Blue screen after driver update. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen after driver update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Storage controller not loading' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Storage controller not loading. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Storage controller not loading - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Keyboard driver error — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Keyboard driver error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Keyboard driver error - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Wi-Fi driver corrupted. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Wi-Fi driver corrupted. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Wi-Fi driver corrupted - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: No output device found — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: No output device found. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: No output device found - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Black screen after GPU update appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after GPU update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Device not initialized' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device not initialized. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Device not initialized - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Blue screen after driver update' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen after driver update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Install failed due to compatibility — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Install failed due to compatibility. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Install failed due to compatibility - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Black screen after GPU update' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after GPU update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Black screen after GPU update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Code 56 network conflict. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 56 network conflict. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Code 56 network conflict - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'TPM driver issues' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: TPM driver issues. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Firmware / BIOS-Dependent Driver Errors.
cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.
step_5: If unsure, contact vendor support for guided firmware/driver updates.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: TPM driver issues - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Keyboard driver error' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Keyboard driver error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Keyboard driver error - Driver event logged in system.

cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.

user_error_text: My device shows 'USB driver not recognized' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB driver not recognized. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: USB driver not recognized - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: No output device found appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: No output device found. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: No output device found - Driver event logged in system.

step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: AHCI driver crash - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Network adapter missing' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Network adapter missing. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Network adapter missing - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'USB controller error' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB controller error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: USB controller error - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Touchpad not working appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Touchpad not working. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Touchpad not working - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: CM_PROB_FAILED_START. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: CM_PROB_FAILED_START. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: CM_PROB_FAILED_START - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Blue screen after driver update' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen after driver update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Black screen after GPU update. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after GPU update. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Black screen after GPU update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'No output device found' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: No output device found. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: No output device found - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Windows Update driver failure' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update driver failure. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Windows Update driver failure - Driver event logged in system.

step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Blue screen after driver update - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Install failed due to compatibility — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Install failed due to compatibility. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Install failed due to compatibility - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: TPM driver issues — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: TPM driver issues. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Firmware / BIOS-Dependent Driver Errors.
cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.
step_5: If unsure, contact vendor support for guided firmware/driver updates.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: TPM driver issues - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Code 10: Device cannot start — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 10: Device cannot start. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Code 10: Device cannot start - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: GPU driver crash. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU driver crash. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: GPU driver crash - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Device not initialized' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Device not initialized. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Device not initialized - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Code 56 network conflict' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 56 network conflict. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Code 56 network conflict - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Audio service not responding — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Driver event logged in system.

symptoms: Symptoms: Input device not detected. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Touchpad / Keyboard / Input Driver Problems.
cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.
step_1: Enable touchpad in Settings → Devices and check for driver updates.
step_2: Uninstall and reinstall the touchpad/keyboard driver from Device Manager.
step_3: Check BIOS/UEFI settings for internal pointing device being enabled.
step_4: Install OEM driver package (Synaptics/Elan) if generic drivers fail.
step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Input device not detected - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: USB controller error. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: USB controller error. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: USB controller error - Driver event logged in system.

symptoms: Symptoms: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: Error: Incorrect driver package — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Incorrect driver package. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Incorrect driver package - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Storage controller not loading. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Storage controller not loading. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Storage controller not loading - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'Code 56 network conflict' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 56 network conflict. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Code 56 network conflict - Driver event logged in system.

symptoms: Symptoms: USB device malfunctioned. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: USB & Peripheral Driver Errors.
cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.
step_1: Try different USB ports and cables to rule out port or cable faults.
step_2: Uninstall USB controller drivers and reboot to let Windows reinstall them.
step_3: Check power management settings and disable selective suspend for USB hubs.
step_4: Update firmware for peripherals (printers, webcams) and reinstall drivers.
step_5: If device still malfunctions, test on another PC to confirm peripheral failure.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Ethernet driver not installed' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Ethernet driver not installed. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Ethernet driver not installed - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Incorrect driver package. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Incorrect driver package. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Incorrect driver package - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: AHCI driver crash — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: AHCI driver crash. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: AHCI driver crash - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Intel ME/AMD PSP driver failure — hardware not functioning as expected.

cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.

verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

cause: Input driver missing or misconfigured causing input devices to fail.

step_5: If hardware faulty, use external mouse/keyboard and plan replacement.

cause: USB controller/driver failure or peripheral firmware bug.

step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.
step_5: If using OEM network utilities, uninstall them to avoid driver conflicts.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Network adapter missing - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: Multiple drivers conflicting. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: Multiple drivers conflicting. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Multiple drivers conflicting - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Unsigned driver blocked' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Unsigned driver blocked. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Unsigned driver blocked - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: After driver install I get: CM_PROB_FAILED_START. What should I do?
symptoms: Symptoms: CM_PROB_FAILED_START. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Device Manager Errors / Yellow Warnings.
cause: Windows detected device initialization failure due to driver or hardware problem.
step_1: Open Device Manager, right-click the problematic device, and select Uninstall device.
step_2: Restart the PC to allow Windows to reinstall the driver automatically.
step_3: If reinstall fails, download the latest driver from the device manufacturer.
step_4: Check for hardware conflicts and ensure device is enabled in BIOS/UEFI.
step_5: If hardware appears faulty, test it on another PC or replace the device.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: CM_PROB_FAILED_START - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: My device shows 'Code 56 network conflict' and does not work correctly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Code 56 network conflict. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Network Driver Issues.
cause: Network driver corruption or missing drivers for the adapter.
step_1: Open Device Manager, uninstall the network adapter driver, and reboot to reinstall.
step_2: Download the latest adapter drivers from the manufacturer and install them.
step_3: Reset network stack: `netsh int ip reset` and `netsh winsock reset` then reboot.
step_4: If Wi‑Fi card not detected, test with a USB Wi‑Fi dongle to isolate hardware fault.

user_error_text: Audio service not responding appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Audio service not responding. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Audio service not responding - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: AHCI driver crash appears and the device is unavailable.
symptoms: Symptoms: AHCI driver crash. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Storage & SATA/NVMe Driver Problems.
cause: Storage driver/controller failure preventing drive access at OS level.
step_1: Ensure storage controller driver is present in Device Manager and update it.
step_2: If INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE occurs, boot to recovery and restore proper storage drivers.
step_3: Update motherboard chipset and SATA/NVMe drivers from vendor website.
step_4: Check BIOS settings (AHCI/RAID mode) match the installed driver expectations.
step_5: If driver issues persist, backup data and reinstall OS after restoring correct drivers.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: AHCI driver crash - Driver event logged in system.

symptoms: Symptoms: TPM driver issues. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Firmware / BIOS-Dependent Driver Errors.
cause: Driver requires specific firmware/BIOS support or vendor firmware update.
step_1: Check vendor site for BIOS/UEFI updates and follow official update instructions.
step_2: Ensure TPM firmware/drivers are compatible with your Windows version before updating.
step_3: If ACPI errors appear, reset BIOS to defaults and update to latest recommended firmware.
step_4: Coordinate firmware updates with driver updates to avoid mismatches.
step_5: If unsure, contact vendor support for guided firmware/driver updates.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: TPM driver issues - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE - Driver event logged in system.

verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.

user_error_text: Error: Incorrect driver package — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Incorrect driver package. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Installation / Update Failures.
cause: Installer/driver package incompatible with OS or blocked by signature enforcement.
step_1: Download the correct driver package matching your OS and system architecture.
step_2: Run installer as Administrator and disable antivirus during installation if safe.
step_3: If driver blocked, enable Test Mode or install signed drivers only to maintain security.
step_4: Use Device Manager to update driver and point to the downloaded package.
step_5: Roll back any recent updates and try installing an older, compatible driver.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Incorrect driver package - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: GPU driver crash — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU driver crash. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: GPU / Display Driver Errors.
cause: Graphics driver instability, incompatible driver, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using DDU, then reinstall latest stable drivers.
step_2: Check GPU power connectors and reseat the GPU in PCIe slot if applicable.
step_3: Test with integrated graphics to determine if GPU hardware is at fault.
step_4: Update motherboard chipset drivers and GPU firmware if available.
step_5: If GPU shows artifacts or fails in another system, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: GPU driver crash - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: I see 'No output device found' in Device Manager after an update.
symptoms: Symptoms: No output device found. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Audio Device Driver Errors.
cause: Audio driver missing/corrupt, Windows audio service failure, or hardware issue.
step_1: Open Sound settings and check output device selection; ensure not muted.
step_2: Uninstall audio driver from Device Manager and restart to let Windows reinstall.
step_3: Download and install the latest Realtek or OEM audio driver from vendor site.
step_4: Restart Windows Audio service (services.msc) and check service dependencies.
step_5: If physical audio jack is damaged, use USB audio or external DAC as a workaround.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: No output device found - Driver event logged in system.

user_error_text: Error: Multiple drivers conflicting — hardware not functioning as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Multiple drivers conflicting. Device unavailable, drivers show issues, or system instability. Category: Driver Corruption / Conflicts.
cause: Corrupted driver files or conflicting drivers after updates causing crashes.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall the problematic driver from Device Manager.
step_2: Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for GPU drivers to remove traces before reinstalling.
step_3: Download a clean driver package from OEM and install it cleanly.
step_4: Check Event Viewer for driver-specific errors and address underlying issues.
step_5: If conflicts persist, perform a system restore to a point before driver changes.
verification: Device operates normally and driver errors no longer appear in Device Manager.
log_snippet: Multiple drivers conflicting - Driver event logged in system.
